text.title: part0_RuPaul speaks about society and the state of drag as performance art

head.s: RuPaul speaks about society and the state of drag as performance art

p.s:
Few artists ever penetrate the subconscious level of American culture the way
RuPaul Andre Charles
did with the 1993 album
Supermodel of the World
.

It was groundbreaking not only because in the midst of the
Grunge
phenomenon did Charles have a dance hit on
MTV
, but because he did it as RuPaul , formerly known as
Starbooty
, a supermodel drag queen with a message : love everyone .

A duet with
Elton John
, an endorsement deal with
MAC cosmetics
, an eponymous talk show on
VH-1
and roles in film propelled RuPaul into the new millennium .

text.p:
In July , RuPaul 's movie
Starrbooty
began playing at film festivals and it is set to be released on DVD October 31st .
Wikinews
reporter
David Shankbone
recently spoke with RuPaul by telephone in Los Angeles , where she is to appear on stage for
DIVAS Simply Singing !
, a benefit for HIV-AIDS .

RP :
Everything is great .
I just settled into my new hotel room in downtown
Los Angeles
.
I have never stayed downtown , so I wanted to try it out .
L.A. is one of those traditional big cities where nobody goes downtown , but they are trying to change that .

hi.s: DS : How do you like Los Angeles ?

text.p:
RP :
I love L.A. I ’m from
San Diego
, and I lived here for six years .
It took me four years to fall in love with it and then those last two years I had fallen head over heels in love with it .
Where are you from ?

hi.s: DS : Me ? I ’m from all over .
I have lived in 17 cities , six states and three countries .

text.p:
RP :
Where were you when you were 15 ?

hi.s:
DS : Georgia , in a small town at the bottom of
Fulton County
called
Palmetto
.

text.p:
RP :
When I was in Georgia I went to South Fulton Technical School .
The last high school I ever went to was ... actually , I do n’t remember the name of it .

RP :
I miss the Atlanta that I lived in .
That Atlanta is long gone .
It ’s like a childhood friend who underwent head to toe plastic surgery and who I do n’t recognize anymore .
It ’s not that I do n’t like it ; I do like it .
It ’s just not the Atlanta that I grew up with .
It looks different because it went through that boomtown phase and so it has been transient .
What made Georgia
Georgia
to me is gone .
The last time I stayed in a hotel there my room was overlooking a construction site , and I realized the building that was torn down was a building that I had seen get built .
And it had been torn down to build a new building .
It was something you do n’t expect to see in your lifetime .
